Daniel Hunt Particle Physics DPhil at the University of Oxford

My Expertise

Hi! I'm Dan, a physics student at Oxford. My work focuses on LZ, an experiment in South Dakota dedicated to finding non model specific mass constraints for WIMPs, a leading candidate for dark matter, though I've worked on other physics experiments too. If you want to know what that means, throw me an email. I also love outreach, and would be happy to help educate in any way I can.

Take a look at my CV if you're interested!

Research

I've worked for a number of particle physics collaborations including KLEVER, NA62, NEWS-G, ATLAS, and LZ for my DPhil in Oxford

Code

I've worked in python, using tensorflow, scipy and numpy, and C++, using Geant4, Garfield, and ROOT. I also work regularly in LaTeX, use Debian for my research, and making this website is good html practice!

Outreach

I've a particular interest in physics outreach, having worked several ambambassador roles during my undergrad, giving several speeches on physics topics for the Birmingham Astrophysics society, and working as a teacher at Dame Elizabeth Cadbury Technology College for 4 weeks.
